sentence.Network_en: The bright sunlight made me squint.
sentence.Network_cn: 强烈的阳光刺得我眯起了眼。

sentence.Network_en: A squint can sometimes be corrected by an eyepatch.
sentence.Network_cn: 斜视有时候可以通过戴眼罩来纠正.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'squinting', as in squint-eyed): shortening of asquint

entry.def: If you squint at something, you look at it with your eyes partly closed.

example.ex: The girl squinted at the photograph...
example.tran: 女孩觑着眼看那张照片。

example.ex: The man squinted up at him...

entry.def: If someone has a squint, their eyes look in different directions from each other.

means.word_mean: 1. abnormal alignment of one or both eyes

sentences.sentence: "The children squinted to frighten each other"

means.word_mean: 2. be cross-eyed; have a squint or strabismus
1. (used especially of glances) directed to one side with or as if with doubt or suspicion or envy;

sentences.sentence: "her eyes with their misted askance look"- Elizabeth Bowen

auth_sentence.content: She'd a slight squint in her left eye.
auth_sentence.res_content: She'd a slight squint in her left eye.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She'd a slight squint in her left eye.

auth_sentence.content: He narrowed his squint and focussed all his attention.
auth_sentence.res_content: He narrowed his squint and focussed all his attention.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He narrowed his squint and focussed all his attention.

auth_sentence.content: I squint at the script he is working on.
auth_sentence.res_content: I squint at the script he is working on.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I squint at the script he is working on.

means.word_mean: 眯着眼睛, 斜着眼睛(看某物);瞟;从小孔或缝隙里看

sentences.en: Her eyes squinted against the brightness.
Pulling his rifle to his shoulder he squinted along the barrel.
sentences.cn: 他把枪顶肩，眯起眼睛瞄准。

sentences.en: The sun was shinning straight in her eyes which made her squint.
sentences.cn: 太阳直射着她的眼睛, 使她眯起了眼睛。

sentences.en: A squint can sometimes be corrected by an eyepatch.
sentences.cn: 斜视有时候可以通过戴眼罩来纠正。
